snippet: The idea behind VSED is to peacefully speed up the process of dying, and doesn’t require a physician’s approval or a terminal diagnosis....
abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age column notes small but determined group of people with serious illnesses who wish to end their lives have done so by voluntarily stopping eating and drinking, or VSED; says option appeals to some because it requires no doctor's consent or governmental action, but does require some precautions and strong will.
lead_paragraph: The idea behind VSED is to peacefully speed up the process of dying, and doesn’t require a physician’s approval or a terminal diagnosis.

headline.print_headline: To Hasten the End, Some Patients Don’t Eat or Drink
headline.main: The VSED Exit: A Way to Speed Up Dying, Without Asking Permission

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Living Wills and Health Care Proxies
